ble ways of arriving at it from the argument I mentioned at the outset.
2. The extreme view could of course be weakened to say that while abor-
tion is permissible to save the mother’s life, it may not be performed by a
third party, but only by the mother herself. But this cannot be right either.
For what we have to keep in mind is that the mother and the unborn child
are not like two tenants in a small house which has, by an unfortunate m
